title: thread 'rustc' panicked at 'assertion failed: !suggestion.is_empty()', compiler/rustc_errors/src/diagnostic.rs:342:9

labels.name: I-ICE
labels.description: Issue: The compiler panicked, giving an Internal Compilation Error (ICE) ❄️

labels.name: T-compiler
labels.description: Relevant to the compiler team, which will review and decide on the PR/issue.

body:
I'm seeing an internal compiler error on the following input, found by [fuzz-rustc](https://github.com/dwrensha/fuzz-rustc): ### Code ```Rust #[d=n(_:d:,)] ``` ### Error output ``` error: expected identifier, found reserved identifier `_` --> src/lib.rs:1:7 | 1 | #[d=n(_:d:,)] | ^ expected identifier, found reserved identifier error: expected type, found `,` --> src/lib.rs:1:11 | 1 | #[d=n(_:d:,)] | - -^ expected type | | | | | tried to parse a type due to this type ascription | while parsing this struct | = note: `#![feature(type_ascription)]` lets you annotate an expression with a type: `: ` = note: see issue #23416 for more information thread 'rustc' panicked at 'assertion failed: !suggestion.is_empty()', compiler/rustc_errors/src/diagnostic.rs:342:9 ``` Affected versions: I tried nightly 2021-12-01 and stable 1.57 and they both show the same ICE.
Backtrace

``` Compiling playground v0.0.1 (/playground) error: expected identifier, found reserved identifier `_` --> src/lib.rs:1:7 | 1 | #[d=n(_:d:,)] | ^ expected identifier, found reserved identifier error: expected type, found `,` --> src/lib.rs:1:11 | 1 | #[d=n(_:d:,)] | - -^ expected type | | | | | tried to parse a type due to this type ascription | while parsing this struct | = note: `#![feature(type_ascription)]` lets you annotate an expression with a type: `: ` = note: see issue #23416 for more information thread 'rustc' panicked at 'assertion failed: !suggestion.is_empty()', compiler/rustc_errors/src/diagnostic.rs:342:9 stack backtrace: 0: rust_begin_unwind at /rustc/48a5999fceeea84a8971634355287faa349909d4/library/std/src/panicking.rs:498:5 1: core::panicking::panic_fmt at /rustc/48a5999fceeea84a8971634355287faa349909d4/library/core/src/panicking.rs:107:14 2: core::panicking::panic at /rustc/48a5999fceeea84a8971634355287faa349909d4/library/core/src/panicking.rs:48:5 3: ::multipart_suggestion_with_style 4: ::multipart_suggestion 5: ::collect_tokens_for_expr::<::parse_dot_or_call_expr::{closure#0}> 6: ::parse_prefix_expr 7: ::parse_assoc_expr_with 8: ::collect_tokens_no_attrs::, ::parse_expr_force_collect::{closure#0}> 9: ::parse_attr_item::{closure#0} 10: ::parse_attribute 11: ::parse_outer_attributes 12: ::parse_mod 13: rustc_parse::parse_crate_from_file 14: ::time::, rustc_interface::passes::parse::{closure#0}> 15: ::parse 16: ::enter::, rustc_errors::ErrorReported>> 17: rustc_span::with_source_map::, rustc_interface::interface::create_compiler_and_run, rustc_driver::run_compiler::{closure#1}>::{closure#1}> 18: >::set::, rustc_driver::run_compiler::{closure#1}>::{closure#0}, core::result::Result<(), rustc_errors::ErrorReported>>::{closure#0}::{closure#0}, core::result::Result<(), rustc_errors::ErrorReported>> note: Some details are omitted, run with `RUST_BACKTRACE=full` for a verbose backtrace. error: internal compiler error: unexpected panic note: the compiler unexpectedly panicked. this is a bug. note: we would appreciate a bug report: https://github.com/rust-lang/rust/issues/new?labels=C-bug%2C+I-ICE%2C+T-compiler&template=ice.md note: rustc 1.59.0-nightly (48a5999fc 2021-12-01) running on x86_64-unknown-linux-gnu note: compiler flags: -C embed-bitcode=no -C codegen-units=1 -C debuginfo=2 --crate-type lib note: some of the compiler flags provided by cargo are hidden query stack during panic: end of query stack error: could not compile `playground` due to 2 previous errors ```
